page.title: 01Fownhope and the River Wye
page.content: The river Why mearders through the western side of the area with flat readows on either side which are liable to frequent flooding - good agriculture land. The middle and eastern part of the area is very wooded. Most of this is Hauge Wood, an area, mostly confiers, owned by the forestry commission. This area is very popular for walkes and ornithologists from Hereford as it has numerous public tracks. In the south of the area is the prosperous village of Fownhope. In recent years the private housing estate have been built of about 50 houses/bungalows in each. These are mainly occupied by retired people and those who work in hereford - six miles away. The remainder of the scattered community in the rest of the area are largely corrected with agriculture.
